author: Michael Larabel
description: Valve today released SteamOS 3.7.8 to their stable channel as the first stable version of their Arch Linux based SteamOS 3.7 operating system...
title: SteamOS 3.7 Stable Rolls Out With Updated Linux Kernel, Expanding AMD Handheld Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ubuntu 25.10 is joining the likes of Red Hat Enterprise Linux and SUSE Linux Enterprise that are using Chrony as their Network Time Protocol (NTP) implementation. Ubuntu 25.10 is switching over to Chrony in enabling Network Time Security (NTS) support on Ubuntu Linux...
title: Ubuntu 25.10 Switching To Chrony By Default, Enabling Network Time Security

author: Michael Larabel
description: Mozilla announced today it's going to be shutting down its Pocket read-it-later bookmarking service this summer...
title: Mozilla Is Shutting Down Pocket

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Canonical Kernel Team confirmed their plans today that with the Ubuntu 25.10 release in October they are planning to employ the Linux 6.17 kernel...
title: Canonical Planning For Linux 6.17 To Power Ubuntu 25.10

author: Michael Larabel
description: Adding on to the Intel Xeon 6 "Granite Rapids" CPU family are today three new models focused on delivering enhanced GPU-accelerated AI performance...
title: Intel Announces New Xeon 6 CPU Models With SST-TF & Priority Core Turbo "PCT"

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last week I began posting Linux benchmarks of the flagship "Strix Halo" SoC, the AMD Ryzen AI Max+ PRO 395 with powerful Radeon 8060S graphics using the HP ZBook Ultra G1a laptop. Both the CPU and GPU results for the data published thus far have been mighty impressive and done at the Ubuntu Linux defaults... But the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 within the ZBook Ultra G1a can be pushed even further by leveraging the ACPI Platform Profiles capabilities. In this article is showing how much further performance -- and the power costs -- can be achieved out of this AMD Strix Halo SoC when leveraging the HP Power Profiles as well as the power efficiency for those wanting to run the SoC instead in the "power saver" / "low power" configuration.
title: Maximizing The Performance & Power Efficiency Of AMD Ryzen AI Max+ 395 With Platform Profiles

author: Michael Larabel
description: PoCL 7.0 is out today as the newest version of this "Portable Computing Language" implementation that originally was started for supporting CPU-based OpenCL execution but with time and in leveraging LLVM back-ends has added support for OpenCL atop AMDKFD / NVIDIA PTX / Intel Level Zero and other possible back-ends...
title: PoCL 7.0 Released With Official OpenCL 3.0 Conformance On x86_64 CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Longtime AMDGPU driver engineer Alex Deucher has posted an interesting set of patches on Wednesday for enhancing the GPU reset experience under Linux with RDNA graphics cards...
title: AMD Preparing For Some Nice GPU Reset Improvements Under Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: A recently posted patch series for the MSI WMI platform driver is aiming this open-source driver to reach parity with MSI's official Windows application/driver for the MSI Claw gaming handheld systems...
title: MSI Linux Driver Aims For Parity To Windows App For The Claw Gaming Handhelds

author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch series is baking for likely upstreaming in the Linux v6.17 kernel cycle later in the year to optimize AMD CPU cache flushing when making use of Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) with KVM...
title: Optimized AMD SEV Cache Flushing For KVM Looked At For Linux 6.17

author: Michael Larabel
description: With Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 providing a RISC-V developer preview, CentOS is now in turn also providing initial RISC-V CPU ISA support...
title: CentOS Now Providing Initial RISC-V Support
